H0.text: Which charity was founded in London in 1961 following the publication of the article 'The Forgotten Prisoners' in 'The Observer'. Human Rights Watch

H1.text: Which charity was founded in London in 1961 following the publication of the article 'The Forgotten Prisoners' in 'The Observer'. Anti-Slavery International

H2.text: Which charity was founded in London in 1961 following the publication of the article 'The Forgotten Prisoners' in 'The Observer'. Liberty

H3.text: Which charity was founded in London in 1961 following the publication of the article 'The Forgotten Prisoners' in 'The Observer'. Amnesty.org

A4.text: Amnesty International was founded in London in July 1961 by English barrister Peter Benenson, who had previously been a founding member of the UK law reform organization JUSTICE.

A5.text: In July 1961, the leadership had decided that the appeal would form the basis of a permanent organization, Amnesty, with the first meeting taking place in London.
